intro: Pedicularis lyrata var. cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of North America. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its lanceolate to heart-shaped leaves and clusters of vivid pink or red flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations. Due to its specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sensitive indicator of alpine ecosystem health.
